channel.title: Mac OS Fundamentals on Analyst
channel.description: Recent content in Mac OS Fundamentals on Analyst

item.title: Apple Encryption
item.description: Applications or even OS itself doesn’t know the keys that are protected by Secure Enclave. OS only sees Keychain, but the Security Enclave is separated.

item.title: Apple Mach-O File
item.description: Intro Using otool we can get general info about the Mach-O file: otool -h [app_name] > Mach header magic cputype cpusubtype caps filetype ncmds sizeofcmds flags 0xfeedfacf 16777228 0 0x00 2 115 11384 0x00218085 Quick refernce on the meaning:

item.title: MacOS Fundamentals
item.description: Firewall You can set specific rules to limit the traffic. FireVault No recovery once this password is lost.

item.title: Apple LAContext vs User Presence
item.description: In this article I’n going to research this: how LAContext is different from User Presence, in what way it’s better.

item.title: Apple File Systems
item.description: HFS HFS+ Supports large files Efficient disk space usage unicode for filenames name forks file compression journaling dynamic resizing, defragmentation not only for MacOS APFS Clones Snapshots Space sharing encryption crash protection sparse files fast directory resizing iOS has two partitions: system and user.
